required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Corneal Cross Linking and Topography Guided Excimer Laser Treatment
clinical_study.official_title: Topography Guided Excimer Laser Surface Ablation in Combination With Corneal Cross-linking (CCL) in Patients With Progressive Ectatic Corneal Disorders.

brief_summary.textblock:
Topography guided laser treatment enables the surgeon to correct higher order aberrations in corneas with irregular astigmatism. Several case reports and small uncontrolled trials have been published on the combination of this treatment with corneal cross linking (CCL) in patients with ectatic corneal diseases.
This randomized study will evaluate the safety and efficacy of a combined treatment of corneal cross linking with a partial topography guided excimer laser treatment in eyes with progressive ectatic corneal diseases.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Progression of ectatic disease (by use of maximum keratometry readings = Kmax)

arm_group.description: Patients will receive a standard corneal cross linking treatment

arm_group.arm_group_label: Corneal Cross Linking and Topo Laser
arm_group.description: Patients will receive a topography guided laser treatment in combination with a standard corneal cross linking treatment in the same session.

intervention.intervention_name: Topography guided Excimer Laser treatment and Corneal Cross Linking
intervention.description: A topography guided excimer laser treatment will be performed prior to CCL in one session.
intervention.arm_group_label: Corneal Cross Linking and Topo Laser

intervention.description: A standard corneal cross linking procedure will be performed in this arm.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Signed informed consent
- Patient age 18 - 40 years
- Documented progressive corneal ectatic disease except post LASIK/LASEK ectasia
Exclusion Criteria:
- Allergy to one of the used substances
- Tendency towards excessive scar formation
- Pregnancy
- Rheumatic diseases
- Central corneal thickness below 450 Âµm
- Active infection of the study eye
- Previous corneal surgery of the study eye

facility.name: Medical University of Vienna, Department of Ophthalmology
